title: Will HDFC Bank sell at least $1 billion of loans by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, HDFC Bank has successfully sold loan portfolios worth $1 billion or more through the issuance of pass-through certificates or similar debt instruments. The sale must be confirmed through official announcements by HDFC Bank or reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Financial Times, or The Economic Times). If the sale is not completed or is for an amount less than $1 billion by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. The sale amount will be calculated based on the Indian Rupee to US Dollar exchange rate on the date of the sale announcement.

The issuance must be confirmed through official announcements by HDFC Bank or reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Financial Times, or The Economic Times). The pass-through certificates must be issued as part of a strategy to manage the bank's loan portfolio or address funding gaps. If no such issuance meeting these criteria occurs by the specified date, or if the total value is less than $1 billion, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will India's major reservoirs have increased water levels by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, official government reports or at least three reputable news sources confirm that the water levels in India's major reservoirs have increased compared to their levels at the beginning of October 2023. Major reservoirs are defined as those monitored by India's Central Water Commission. The increase must be an average across all major reservoirs, not just in specific regions. If no such increase is confirmed, or if reports indicate a decrease or no change in water levels, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will India report a bumper harvest for both rice and soybeans by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, India officially reports a bumper harvest for both rice and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the Indian Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times of India). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either rice or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, India reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and rapeseed, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Indian Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and rapeseed being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy publicly condemn a Russian attack on Ukraine by August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is reported to have publicly condemned a Russian attack on Ukraine. The condemnation must meet the following criteria:

1. It must be made by Volodymyr Zelenskyy in his capacity as the President of Ukraine.
2. It must specifically refer to an attack or military action by Russia against Ukraine.
3. The condemnation must be publicly accessible, such as through official government statements, press conferences, or social media posts from verified accounts.
4. The condemnation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, Al Jazeera).

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. No such condemnation meeting the above criteria is reported by August 31, 2024.
2. Zelenskyy is no longer the President of Ukraine by the resolution date.
3. The reported condemnation is later proven to be false or misattributed.

Note: This question does not require the attack to be a new or future attack; it could be a condemnation of any Russian attack on Ukraine, including ongoing conflicts or past events, as long as the condemnation itself occurs within the specified timeframe.

title: Will Boeing's Starliner capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Boeing's Starliner capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Starliner capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.

title: Will major European stock market indices fully recover from their October 2023 levels by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, at least two of the following major European stock market indices: FTSE 100, DAX, and CAC 40, close at or above their respective closing levels as of October 1, 2023. The closing levels will be verified using data from reputable financial information providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Financial Times. If fewer than two of these indices reach or exceed their October 1, 2023 closing levels by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. In case of any stock splits or reverse splits during this period, the index values will be adjusted accordingly for fair comparison.

title: Will Intel lay off at least 15% of its workforce by August 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Intel has completed layoffs affecting at least 15% of its workforce (approximately 15,000 jobs). The completion of layoffs must be confirmed by either:

1. An official statement from Intel, or
2. Reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, CNBC).

The layoff percentage will be calculated based on Intel's workforce size at the time of the announcement. If Intel reduces the scope of the layoffs to less than 15% of its workforce, or if the layoffs are not completed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

Note: This question is based on Intel's announcement of planned layoffs as of October 1, 2023. Any changes to the plan after this date will not affect the resolution criteria.

title: Will Utah's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Utah's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Utah state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

title: Will the average weekly jobless claims in the U.S. fall below 200,000 for any month by August 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there is at least one calendar month where the average weekly jobless claims in the United States fall below 200,000. The average will be calculated based on the official weekly jobless claims reports for all weeks within a given month, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor. For verification, data from the U.S. Department of Labor or reports from at least three major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal) will be considered. If no such month occurs where the average weekly jobless claims fall below 200,000, the question will resolve as NO.

title: Will the USDA distribute over $2 billion to minority farmers by August 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) has distributed more than $2 billion in federal aid specifically to Black and other minority farmers, as part of a program addressing historical discrimination. The distribution must be confirmed by official USDA reports or statements and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the total distributed amount is less than or equal to $2 billion by the specified date, or if the distribution is not specifically targeted at minority farmers, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'distributed' means the funds have been successfully transferred to the intended recipients.
